meanings.definition: Scatter or spread (things) untidily over a surface or area.
meanings.sent1: She strewed the toys across the floor.
meanings.sent2: The wind strewed the leaves all over the yard.
meanings.sent3: He accidentally strewed his papers everywhere when he sneezed.
meanings.sent4: The artist strewed colors on the canvas, creating a masterpiece.
meanings.sent5: The baker strewed sugar on top of the freshly baked cookies.

meanings.definition: Cover (a surface or area) with untidily scattered things.
meanings.sent1: The kids strewed their toys in every corner of the room.
meanings.sent2: The gardener strewed seeds in the soil to grow flowers.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat strewed litter all over the house.
meanings.sent4: The storm strewed debris across the road, blocking traffic.
meanings.sent5: The chef strewed herbs on top of the dish for added flavor.
